adjectives.description: botchy (comparative more botchy, superlative most botchy)

entries.meaning: Full of botches or mistakes; poorly done.
examples: Read over again my letter to the Lord Chancellor, and my last letter to yourself, and if they do not satisfy you that I am right in looking forward to a more substantial ecclesiastical reform, and in not promoting this botchy business, you must forgive me if I never say another word to you on the subject.
